channel.title: Someone help me?
channel.description: Hey i was wondering if it was possible to make it so when my autorestarter that i have is about to restart it sends a message to the server and says for everyone to log out before the restart so people dont like lose progress and stuff. Thanks if you can help me with this.

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @icebabe11 icebabe11
item.description:
@icebabe11 wrote:

Sorry. Can’t help you… My pc was rebooted and everything was deleted. Had to get rid of a virus that kept eating my RAM and computer space. Note: You can code something like what I made in 5 mins with visual basic…

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @coolpup2233 coolpup2233
item.description:
@coolpup2233 wrote:

ziplock im not really the brightest when it comes to server coding. You are a complete dumbass if you saying this right now. This is a server help section, I am asking for help about a autorestarter thing. By you telling me to do it myself is not helping me whatsoever. Please icebabe post or pm me that tool. Would help a bunch. Thanks

-Coolpup2233-

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

How about you program one yourself. A server restarter is not godly or even hard to program at all. It’s basically calling methods from your server using a java application.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I’ll explain:
If you want to warn everyone about something pretty much all servers have a ::yell command.
If you want to kick all people to update a server you end the process and re-run the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @icebabe11 icebabe11
item.description:
@icebabe11 wrote:

Lol, Fat cookies your mainly posting what someone else said for no reason… Silab think it’s better for no auto restarter. BUT this is going off topic for you… So, let’s get back ON TOPIC, this guy just asked for a way to make the server warn everyone then kick them all eventually… No reason to add what you feel.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

Server Restarters - fucking fail nothing more.

[quote="_Vengeance, post:14, topic:271638"]Best solution: run a stable server.
Next best, if you feel you absolutely must use an “auto restarter,” is to make use of the system update mechanism to warn everyone and log them out prior to the actual restart.
I can’t imagine playing a game that had to be restarted every 30 minutes though, so I would go with solution 1.[/quote]
QFT

'nuff said

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:16, topic:271638"]A well programmed server should be able to run for months on end (with the capability of being able to run for in excess of a year) without needing to be restarted.

By the way,

That would be rediciously hard to find in the tutorial section.

That’s why there is a search bar.[/quote]

I know i was just pointing out to that guy on what he had stated.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

A well programmed server should be able to run for months on end (with the capability of being able to run for in excess of a year) without needing to be restarted.

By the way,

TabbyKiller:

That would be rediciously hard to find in the tutorial section.

That’s why there is a search bar.

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:14, topic:271638"]Best solution: run a stable server.
Next best, if you feel you absolutely must use an “auto restarter,” is to make use of the system update mechanism to warn everyone and log them out prior to the actual restart.
I can’t imagine playing a game that had to be restarted every 30 minutes though, so I would go with solution 1.[/quote]

Either no auto restart or estimate a longer timer?

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

Best solution: run a stable server.
Next best, if you feel you absolutely must use an “auto restarter,” is to make use of the system update mechanism to warn everyone and log them out prior to the actual restart.
I can’t imagine playing a game that had to be restarted every 30 minutes though, so I would go with solution 1.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?

item.description:

READ! Before they are kicked, all the gamedata will be saved![/quote]

He is trying to send them a message not conclude a update countdown.
And it is not a update it is a restart.

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @icebabe11 icebabe11
item.description:
@icebabe11 wrote:

Most servers these days have the code ::lupdate, so CTRL +F it in your client.java Try finding either one. ::update or ::lupdate. Some servers even have “::announce”.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @Robintje1 Robintje1
item.description:
@Robintje1 wrote:

My code from update in client.java is:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“update”) && playerRights ==3 && command.length() > 10) { //playerRights ==3 because only admins can do that.
PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = (Integer.parseInt(
command.substring(7))
+ 1);
PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();

        }[/code]

@TabbyKiller:
READ! Before they are kicked, all the gamedata will be saved!

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“Robintje1, post:7, topic:271638”]Or use ::update. (If your server have it)
Or you can use:

if (command.startsWith("kickall") && playerRights >=2) { PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true; } Set this in client.java.
All the data will be saved before they are kicked. That command is pretty easy. But I use the ::update (time in sec.) command.[/quote]

Thats what he trying to avoid is kicking everyone so they dont lose progess in the game.

coolpup2233:

so people dont like lose progress and stuff. Thanks if you can help me with this.

Listen to my last post.

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:6, topic:271638”][quote author=icebabe11 link=topic=358466.msg2736813#msg2736813 date=1239093451]
Or, you can search the already made tuts for help :]
[/quote]
That would be rediciously hard to find in the tutorial section.

Thats why he posted it here.

Back to the topic. I would proberly try find a auto messenger or something. That goes within the restarter. Im not sure if this is possible but im sure there is a
auto messenger.

Sorry i couldnt be much of a help[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 07, 2009, 02:45:21 am[/size][hr][quote author=shadytheone link=topic=358466.msg2736814#msg2736814 date=1239093629]
u would put it in the client.java
but i dunno where and what
best idea is when its like 29 min u send a message to log out and back in…
if its on 30mins like mad said…

[/quote]
Using the auto messenger within the client.java will not have the same timer as the restarter so will not appear to be in the exact time as it was suppose to be.

Just my oppinion. Try it if you want. Im not saying it wont be a seccess just concluding my suggestions.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @icebabe11 icebabe11
item.description:
@icebabe11 wrote:

You can always edit in the client.java to show the “system update in 2:00” or so… Every 28 mins it should say that and countdown in the bottom right corner.
